Package ca.retrylife.jstate

Interface Task<State,​Context>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public interface Task<State,​Context>
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A Task is a high level descriptor of something that is run by a scheduler.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Called whenever this task has been called for the last time before switching to another task.
      State execute​(State currentState, State lastState, Context context)
      This is run periodically while this task is active.
      void setup​(State currentState, State lastState, Context context)
      This is run once, any time this task has just been switched to from another task.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        void setup​(State currentState,
           State lastState,
           Context context)
        This is run once, any time this task has just been switched to from another task. Any reset or setup code needed can be run here.
        Parameters:
        currentState - An enum value describing what this task is
        lastState - An enum value of the last task executed, or NULL if no last task was defined (this happens if there is no default task for a scheduler to run)
        context - The context of the scheduler

      • execute

        State execute​(State currentState,
              State lastState,
              Context context)
        This is run periodically while this task is active. It is expected that the return value is the next task to execute. This can also be NULL to return to the default task, or currentState to keep executing the current task. This may be overridden by external callers.
        Parameters:
        currentState - An enum value describing what this task is
        lastState - An enum value of the last task executed, or NULL if no last task was defined (this happens if there is no default task for a scheduler to run)
        context - The context of the scheduler
        Returns:
        The next task to be run

      • close

        void close()
        Called whenever this task has been called for the last time before switching to another task. Use for temporary cleanup
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
